FuncDef: The display cpu-defend hostcar access-user-info slot command displays statistics about a specified Host-CAR and information bout the access users limited by the Host-CAR, such as MAC addresses, IP addresses, and online status.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies a CAR ID. After the parameter is specified, statistics about a specified Host-CAR is displayed.
The value is an integer in the range 0 to 32767.

Displays information bout the access users limited by a specified Host-CAR, such as MAC addresses, IP addresses, and online status.
-

Examples: MAC             PeVlan/CeVlan             IP address        Username                Status
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
After the Host-CAR is enabled to limit the rate of the packets to be sent to the CPU, running the
display cpu-defend hostcar access-user-info command is recommended in any of the following scenarios:
Check whether the configured Host-CAR takes effect.When user services are affected, check whether the configured Host-CAR limits the rate of the packets to be sent to the CPU.When excessive traffic is sent to the CPU, check whether a specified board sends too much traffic to the CPU so that you can adjust the Host-CAR.

Precautions
In VS mode, this command is supported only by the admin VS.
